message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the analysis of communication rates achievable with polar coding, which is a technique used in information theory and communication systems. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.COMM (Communication and Networking) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves the use of decoding architecture and metrics, which are related to signal processing and machine learning, making cs.SI (Signal Processing) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also involves the derivation of bounds, which is a common technique in optimization and algorithms, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the analysis of capacity, which is a fundamental concept in statistics and probability theory, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category.
